entry.title: Container Registry in Multiple Regions
entry.summary: Aug 12, 04:27 UTC Resolved - From 23:16 - 04:00, updates to DigitalOcean Container Registry images were not displayed correctly in the UI (Cloud Control Panel), due to a lapsed internal authorization token. Our Engineering team was able to issue a new token and rolled out the change regionally in order to not disrupt multiple data planes at once. This issue is fully resolved. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our Support team. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for the inconvenience. Aug 12, 03:54 UTC Monitoring - Our Engineering team has confirmed the root cause of the issue with updates to the UI for DigitalOcean Container Registry and a fix is now rolling out regionally. As this rolls out, we expect users to once again be able to see updates to Container Registry images in the UI (Cloud Control Panel). We will post another update once the fix finishes rolling out in all regions. Aug 12, 02:09 UTC Identified - From 23:16 UTC, our Engineering team has identified an issue with DigitalOcean Container Registry and is actively working on a fix. During this time, customers will not be able to see changes on UI for new DOCR Images in multiple regions. We will post an update as soon as additional information is available.

entry.title: Incident: Trouble signing into the desktop app for some Enterprise Grid customers
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
On August 9, 2023 from 9:00 AM PDT to August 10th 2023, 8:00 AM PDT, some Enterprise Grid users experienced a failure to redirect from browser to app during login - focus was moved to the app, but the sign in process did not complete.
We made a change to some logging functions and introduced a fix that mitigated the issue. This fix is permanent and will keep this issue from happening again.

entry.title: Incident: Users may be experiencing issues uploading images and creating canvases.
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
On August 7, 2023, customers may have experienced issues with loading images, creating canvases, and workflow modals being delayed. A small number of customers may have been impacted as early as 5:50 AM PDT, with larger impact seen between 7:03AM PDT to 7:14AM PDT.
We traced the issue to a change that caused our server infrastructure to be overloaded. We rolled back this change, resolving the issue for all impacted users.

entry.title: Increased site latency
entry.summary: Aug 7, 17:35 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Site performance should be back to normal. Aug 7, 16:26 UTC Monitoring - We've stopped a data migration job that is believed to be contributing, and we're now seeing site latency return back to baseline numbers. The site latency should now be back to normal, but we are continuing to monitor. Aug 7, 16:01 UTC Investigating - There is degraded performance across the Rippling application, with certain pages loading slowly. We are investigating the issue.

entry.title: Incident: Some users may be experiencing issues uploading files.
entry.summary: We’ve restored full functionality to file uploads for all impacted users. You may need to reload Slack (Command/Ctrl + Shift + R) in order for this fix to be reflected on your end. We’re sorry for the disruption we brought to your day.

entry.title: Incident: Users may be experiencing issues connecting to Slack
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On August 2, 2023 from 9:01 AM PDT to 11:00 AM PDT, customers may have experienced issues with blurry images in Slack, as well as trouble uploading files. A small percentage of customers may have also experienced errors or slowness when loading channels, sending messages, accessing admin pages, and connecting to Slack.
An issue with a routine database cluster migration inadvertently caused a decrease in capacity. Unfortunately, this coincided with a scheduled job to process a large number of custom status requests, an activity that commonly occurs at the top of each hour. The number of incoming requests exceeded the unintentionally reduced capacity of the database cluster, leading to errors and sluggishness for some actions in Slack. As these requests piled up, other Slack services began to experience issues as well, including a small number of users being unable to connect.
We paused the scheduled custom status job to immediately mitigate the load on the affected database cluster. This resolved some of the errors affecting Slack services. Once we established we had sufficient capacity to handle the scheduled job, we resumed processing the custom status requests, fully restoring normal service for all affected users.
Once the load was balanced and custom status processing had returned to normal, we deployed a fix to correct the issue with the database cluster migration, bringing capacity back to the expected level.

entry.title: RESOLVED: We're investigating reports of an issue with Classroom. We will provide more information shortly.
entry.summary:
Incident began at 2023-07-24 14:50 and ended at 2023-07-26 11:15 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

Incident Report

Summary

On 24 July 2023 at 07:50, following a Google Classroom iOS app update, the app would not load properly if users attempted to access any course page that had attached materials for a duration of 1 day, 20 hours, 25 minutes. During the disruption, users were able to access course pages by uninstalling and reinstalling the Classroom iOS app.

Root Cause

The root cause has been identified as a bug, triggered by an update released for Classroom iOS, that caused an issue with the local database migration. This caused the iOS app to not load properly when users attempted to access course pages with attached materials, as the migration was specific to the materials configuration.

Remediation and Prevention

Google engineers were alerted to the issue via internal monitoring on 24 July 2023 at 07:50 US/Pacific and immediately started an investigation. Google engineers reproduced the issue, identified the trigger as a failed database migration, and paused the auto update. This prevented any further disruption. An app update with a fix was released for the Classroom iOS app, thereby resolving the issue on 26 July 2023 at 04:15 US/Pacific. Users who had already updated to the problematic app version were advised to either uninstall and reinstall or update the app to the version with the fix.

Google is committed to preventing recurrence by implementing the following action items:

  • Implement additional pre-release migration and application testing plans to validate app stability

Affected products: Classroom

entry.title: Mobile Push Notifications
entry.summary: Aug 1, 10:10 PDT Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Aug 1, 10:10 PDT Investigating - Between 7/26 and 8/1, Notion experienced an issue which prevented users from receiving push notifications on mobile devices. The issue was resolved today, at approximately 9:45 am PDT.

entry.title: Incident: Channel canvases not loading correctly.
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
From July 26th, 2023 at 8:00AM PDT to July 28th 2023 at 1:00PM PDT some users had trouble loading and editing canvases when accessing them from the channel canvas icon.
We determined this issue was caused by a recent code change related to how canvases persist across sessions. We issued a code update which resolved the issue for all impacted users. To see the fix applied, user impacted users should press Command/Control + R. We are also working on deploying a subsequent code update intended to prevent the issue from reoccurring in the future.

entry.title: Incident Affecting LOS Records API
entry.summary: Jul 28, 11:28 PDT Resolved - [False alarm] This incident was a false alarm—the LOS Records API is working as expected. Apologies for the inconvenience. Jul 28, 10:02 PDT Identified - Starting today (July 28, 2023), we identified an issue affecting the LOS Records API. Records for 180 days from today (beyond Jan 24, 2024) are being ignored, and the dates are marked as unavailable on Airbnb, although requests to set those records are not failing. We are actively working to find the root cause, and mitigate this issue. We will post more information as soon as possible.

We recommend to retrieve the details with GET reservations requests. Apologies for the inconvenience caused.

entry.title: Outage: Slack Systemwide Issues
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On July 27, 2023 between 2:03 AM PDT - 2:59 AM PDT, Slack was experiencing a systemwide issue during which users were not able to send or receive messages across multiple platforms.
Our engineering team identified an issue after a change was made to a service that manages our internal system communication. This resulted in degradation of Slack functionality until the change was reverted which resolved the issue for all users.
We are currently hard at work on scoping measures to prevent this from happening in the future. More information about remediation and prevention steps will be included in an upcoming RCA which you can request by writing into feedback@slack.com.

entry.title: Incident: Email service is failing across Slack
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On July 25th, 2023 from 3:00 PM PDT to 6:00 PM PDT we received reports of existing members unable to invite new members to workspaces. We traced the cause of issue to a recent code change which prevented emails from being sent. This also impacted logins, workspace creation and potentially other email-based processes. We’ve reverted this change, and the issue was resolved for all customers.

entry.title: 500 Error Across Multiple Endpoints and Support Tools
entry.summary: Jul 24, 15:37 PDT Resolved - We resolved the incident around 03:00 PM (PDT). Please retry any request that failed during the incident, and don't hesitate to contact us if you need support. Jul 24, 14:16 PDT Investigating - We are actively investigating an increased number of 500 errors across multiple endpoints, as well as timeout errors on the Partner Portal. These errors started today (July 24, 2023) around 02:00 PM PDT. Our engineering teams are working to get everything up and running again, and we will update you with the latest information as soon as possible.

entry.title: Incident: Option to unarchive private channels is missing
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
From 2:46 PM PDT to 6:44 PM PDT on July 21, 2023, some users were unable to unarchive channels to which they belonged.
We determined that a recent code change caused this issue. We reverted the code change and the issue was resolved.

entry.title: Incident: Thread search results may be returning as blank for users.
entry.summary: Users should no longer be experiencing any trouble searching threads. Apologies for the trouble today and thank you for your patience.

entry.title: Incident: Users may be experiencing issues loading threads and sending messages.
entry.summary: Users should no longer be experiencing any trouble loading threads or sending messages. Apologies for the trouble today and thank you for your patience.

entry.title: Delayed scenario executions in the EU1 zone
entry.summary: Jul 23, 16:00 CEST Resolved - Executions of scheduled scenarios in the EU1 zone are delayed.

entry.title: Incident: Some user unable to load profiles
entry.summary: We’ve identified the cause of this issue. Any users encountering a REB9FC2A4F43 error can reload Slack (Command/Ctrl + Shift + R) in order to resolve this error. Thank you for your patience while we sorted out this issue.

entry.title: Incident with Actions, API Requests, Git Operations, Packages, Pages and Pull Requests
entry.summary: Jul 21, 14:01 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Jul 21, 14:01 UTC Update - Actions is operating normally. Jul 21, 14:01 UTC Update - Packages is operating normally. Jul 21, 14:01 UTC Update - API Requests is operating normally. Jul 21, 14:01 UTC Update - Git Operations is operating normally. Jul 21, 14:01 UTC Update - Pages is operating normally. Jul 21, 14:00 UTC Update - Networking issues are fully mitigated and service operation is restored. We will continue to work on follow ups internally but all services are operating normally. Jul 21, 13:45 UTC Update - We have mitigated the network power issue and are watching services recover. We will continue to monitor recovery and return status to green when the issue is fully mitigated. Jul 21, 13:36 UTC Update - API Requests is experiencing degraded performance. We are continuing to investigate. Jul 21, 13:34 UTC Update - We are experiencing a power failure at a datacenter related to our networking infrastructure that is impacting a subset of customers using our services. We are working on mitigating the issue. Jul 21, 13:27 UTC Update - Pull Requests is experiencing degraded performance. We are still investigating and will provide an update when we have one. Jul 21, 13:22 UTC Update - Pages is experiencing degraded performance. We are still investigating and will provide an update when we have one. Jul 21, 13:21 UTC Update - Packages is experiencing degraded performance. We are still investigating and will provide an update when we have one. Jul 21, 13:15 UTC Update - Actions is experiencing degraded performance. We are continuing to investigate. Jul 21, 13:12 UTC Investigating - We are investigating reports of degraded performance for Git Operations.

entry.title: Improvements of our Invoicing app
entry.summary:
Improvement
We’re happy to announce that we just upgraded our Invoicing app with several improvements. Here are the highlights of what you can expect from the latest update: Better User Experience We’ve improved the app to make it more intuitive and user-friendly, with a smoother navigation flow. Enhanced Stability Our developers have put in significant effort to ensure the app’s stability and avoid unexpected crashes or performance hiccups. Improved Search Function Finding invoices and relevant information is now quicker and more precise. Cleaner Interface We understand the importance of a clutter-free interface. The app now flaunts a cleaner and more modern look that ensures a visually appealing invoicing experience. As always, our customer support team is here to assist you should you have any questions or encounter any issues.

author.name: Yannick, Customer Care Team Leader - Pro Team

entry.title: Some users prevented from accessing Notion due to change in request cookie consent
entry.summary: Jul 20, 16:05 PDT Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Jul 20, 15:30 PDT Monitoring - We published a fix and validating the problem is fixed Jul 20, 14:46 PDT Identified - A change to request cookie consent is preventing users from accessing Notion. We have identified the issue and are working on a fix.

entry.title: Spaces directories creation
entry.summary: Jul 20, 22:31 UTC Resolved - As of 21:52 UTC, our Engineering team has confirmed the full resolution of the issue impacting the creation of directories/folders/files in Spaces buckets via the Cloud Control Panel. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our Support team. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for the inconvenience. Jul 20, 22:05 UTC Monitoring - As of 21:32 UTC, our Engineering team has implemented a fix for the issue impacting the creation of directories/folders/files in Spaces buckets in the Cloud Control Panel. We're now monitoring the situation closely. We will post an update as soon as the issue is fully resolved. Jul 20, 21:39 UTC Update - Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with creating directories/folders/files in Spaces buckets using the Cloud Control Panel. During this time, users should still be able to create the Spaces Bucket using Control Panel and API. We will share an update as soon as possible. Jul 20, 21:38 UTC Investigating - Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with creating directories/folders/files in Spaces buckets using the Cloud Control Panel. During this time, users should still be able to create the Spaces Bucket using Control Panel and API. We will share an update as soon as possible.

entry.title: Users cannot access any exported files from pages or workspaces
entry.summary: Jul 20, 15:07 PDT Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Jul 20, 14:57 PDT Investigating - Users are unable to export workspace and page files. We are currently investigating the issue

Jul 18, 16:34 UTC Update - We have mitigated the issue causing slow git operations for some customers and operations should now be performing normally. Jul 18, 16:05 UTC Update - Some customers may be experiencing slow git operations. We have identified the cause of the issue and are working on a mitigation. Jul 18, 15:51 UTC Update - Pull Requests is experiencing degraded performance. We are still investigating and will provide an update when we have one.
